note.p: Education: Westminster School; Christ Church, Oxford (BA 1657; MA 1659)

Career: Became a Roman Catholic; Instructor in grammar, Magdalen College School (1656-1664); Master of Magdalen College School (1663-1664); clerk in the Ticket Office; headmaster of Chelmsford School (1683)
Committee appointments include: Committee for Collecting all the Phenomena of Nature hitherto Observed (1664)
Other RSActivity: Proposed on 9 March 1663 and admitted on the same day he was elected.
Expelled due to non-payment of subscriptions.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Foster; Hunter; ODNB
